unnormalised: Dr. Sunita Reddy has been appointed as the new Director of AIIMS, Hyderabad, effective 10/11/2024. The announcement was made earlier today by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Dr. Reddy, formerly Prof. Reddy at Osmania Medical College, brings with her over 20 years of experience in medical administration and research.
normalised: doctor sunita reddy has been appointed as the new director of A-I-I-M-S, hyderabad, effective tenth november two thousand and twenty four. the announcement was made earlier today by the ministry of health and family welfare. doctor reddy, formerly professor reddy at osmania medical college, brings with her over twenty years of experience in medical administration and research.

unnormalised: The official press release highlighted her contributions to the field of cardiology and her expertise in implementing innovative healthcare programs. Mr. Sharma, the Health Secretary, stated that Dr. Reddy's leadership will be crucial in strengthening AIIMS Hyderabadâ€™s position as a leading medical institution in the country.
normalised: the official press release highlighted her contributions to the field of cardiology and her expertise in implementing innovative healthcare programs. mister sharma, the health secretary, stated that doctor reddy's leadership will be crucial in strengthening A-I-I-M-S hyderabad's position as a leading medical institution in the country.

unnormalised: Prior to her role as Prof. at Osmania, she served as Head of Department at Gandhi Medical College. Dr. Reddy holds an MBBS, MD, and a PhD in Cardiology.
normalised: prior to her role as professor. at osmania, she served as head of department at gandhi medical college. doctor reddy holds an M-B-B-S, M-D, and a P-h-D in cardiology.

unnormalised: The outgoing Director, Dr. Kumar, will be stepping down after completing his 5-year term. A formal farewell is scheduled for 05/11/2024, where Dr. Kumar will be felicitated for his contributions.
normalised: the outgoing director, doctor kumar, will be stepping down after completing his five-year term. a formal farewell is scheduled for fifth november two thousand and twenty four, where doctor kumar will be felicitated for his contributions.
